title: Tesla Urges EPA Not to Remove Emissions Rules Meant to Boost EV Sales
description: The EV giant is urging the Trump administration to reconsider its plans to rescind federal support for EVs.
titleSummary: "Tesla Fights to Preserve Carbon Credit Regulations Favoring Electric Vehicles"
descriptionSummary: The leading electric vehicle manufacturer has issued a plea to the US government, asking them to rethink their decision to withdraw backing for environmentally friendly electric vehicles nationwide.

title: Audi Q9 SUV Coming in 2026 With Room for the Whole Family
description: Audi already offers a three-row SUV with the Q7, which spawned a sleeker two-row Q8, but the automaker isn’t done with massive family haulers just yet. descriptionSummary: Audi is poised to launch a flagship full-size SUV, set to debut alongside an updated Q7 in 2026. This latest addition will offer seating for up to seven passengers and cement the brand's position in the high-end family hauler market.

title: Mercedes Teases New Electric Van Built On Modular Platform
description: Minivans are nowhere near the most popular vehicles on the road, but many companies remain committed to the format. descriptionSummary: Mercedes-Benz is bucking the trend by sticking with minivans, despite their relatively low popularity. The brand's latest addition, an electric van concept, boasts an impressive design and refined ride quality reminiscent of luxury cars.

title: Ford Warns 115,000 Super Duty Owners of Dangerous Steering Defect
description: Ford has announced a major safety recall impacting more than 115,500 Super Duty pickups in the U.S., citing a dangerous defect that could cause the steering column’s upper shaft to detach, leading to a sudden and total loss of steering control. The recall specifically targets 2020–2021 F-250, ...
titleSummary: Ford Alerts 115,000 Super Duty Drivers to Critical Wheel System Flaw
descriptionSummary: Ford has issued a critical safety alert affecting over 115,500 Super Duty trucks in the US, due to a potentially catastrophic flaw that could cause the steering column's upper shaft to come loose, resulting in sudden and complete loss of steering.

title: McLaren CEO Confirms New Model With Space For Your Friends
description: Unlike supercar rivals Lamborghini and Ferrari, McLaren has so far resisted the temptation to jump on the SUV bandwagon. titleSummary: "McLaren's Next Act: A Family-Friendly Ride with Room to Spare Inside"
descriptionSummary: McLaren has thus far defied the trend of high-performance brands embracing SUVs, opting instead to stick with its core values of agility and speed. However, financial pressures have made this stance increasingly difficult to maintain.

title: BMW Says Sedans Aren’t Going Anywhere, Despite SUV Takeover
description: The last decade hasn’t been kind to sedans, as SUVs have taken over the U.S. market. That shift has led some automakers to drop cars to focus on more profitable SUV models, but BMW isn’t getting rid of cars anytime soon. Speaking with Australian publication GoAuto, BMW designer Olver Heilmer ...
titleSummary: "BMW Defies Industry Trend with Pledge to Keep Sedans in Lineup"
descriptionSummary: In recent years, the sedan's popularity has waned in favor of SUVs, prompting several manufacturers to abandon their car lines for more lucrative models. However, BMW remains committed to its sedans, as evidenced by ongoing design efforts.

title: Tesla Sued in China for Broken Self-Driving Promises
description: Tesla’s controversial Full Self-Driving (FSD) system is once again at the center of a legal battle, this time in China. descriptionSummary: A group of seven Tesla owners in China are suing the company, alleging that it exaggerated the capabilities of its Full Self-Driving system and failed to deliver on promises made to consumers. The case is now before a Beijing court.

title: Jaguar Land Rover Production Still Idled as Cyberattacks Spread Across Auto Industry
description: It’s been more three weeks since Jaguar Land Rover was struck by a cyberattack and during that time the automaker has been unable to produce a single vehicle, a crisis reportedly costing it $70 million a week or more. The automaker this week said the shutdown will continue through at least October ...

descriptionSummary: Jaguar Land Rover remains paralyzed after a devastating cyberattack three weeks ago, crippling production and incurring estimated weekly losses of over $70 million as the shutdown is expected to persist through October and beyond.

descriptionSummary: In 2000, Ford's SVT division crafted a beast that silenced critics of American performance. The Cobra R was an unhinged interpretation of the Mustang, prioritizing raw power over pampered luxury in a limited production run of just 300 vehicles.

description: Volvo builds the EX90 and Polestar 3 at its factory in South Carolina, but the bulk of its catalog is produced overseas. title: Washington Beats California At The Pump For The First Time Ever
